jsPsychMonkeys 0.2.5

Function reference

All functions

check_Downloads()
Check csv files in a folder
check_accept_alert()
check_accept_alert Safely checks if there in an alert and accepts it
check_trialids()
check_trialids
clean_up_docker()
Cleans up docker container
complete_task()
Completes a jsPsychMaker task
copy_files_to_data()
In local protocols, move the Downloaded csv to the data folder of the protocol
create_docker()
Creates a docker container
create_links()
create_links
create_monkeys_project()
Create a jsPsychMonkeys project for your data
create_remDr()
Creates remote driver in docker container (opens browser)
create_targets_file()
Create _targets.R file from a protocol folder
debug_docker()
debug_docker
debug_function()
debug_function
get_credentials()
Get credentials from folder
list_data_server()
List files in the .data folder in the server
parse_elements()
Parse website elements to extract and tabulate all the properties
reconnect_to_VNC()
reconnect_to_VNC
release_the_monkeys()
release a horde of Monkeys to complete a jsPsychMakeR protocol
select_input()
Helper to select and interact with input fields
set_parameters()
Process the parameters_monkeys_minimal parameters so a minimal set of input parameters can be used. Also, tries to take into account dependencies between parameters.
setup_folders()
setup_folders Extract jsPsychMonkeys.zip and make sure we have all necessary folders in a specific location
tar_make_future_rowwise()
Makes tar_make_future() work row-wise by assigning priorities to targets using their uid. This allows you to run as many participants as you want, avoiding memory issues.

Developed by Gorka Navarrete.

Site built with pkgdown 2.0.7.
